page.title: 07VICTORIA AVE & FIRST TOWER
page.content: {Victoria Avenue}opened on 22nd June 1887 and is Jersey's only{dual {carriageway.}It runs west along the {Esplanade} following the old Jersey {Western Railway}route from the{Albert {Pier}to the little town of {St.Aubin.} At the {West Park}end of the Avenue is a granite pedestal topped by a crown and inscribed{"Victoria Avenue 22 June {1887".}The railings facing the Avenue have, by law, to be painted black in memory of {Queen Victoria.}Every year an inspector checks it. Anybody with a different colour receives a heavy fine.{First Tower.}At the time of the French Revolution, Jersey built towers in its bays as defence. They were called{Martello Towers}after a famous one in Cape Martello in Corsica.They had numbers, and the{first,}a mile west of the town has given its name to the area around it.
